trial_identification.studytitle: Metabolic Effects of SERMs (Selective Oestrogen Receptor Modulators) in healthy men and healthy postmenopausal women
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Metabolic Effects of SERMs (Selective Oestrogen Receptor Modulators) in healthy men and healthy postmenopausal women

conditions.healthcondition: Metabolic effects in healthy men and healthy postmenopausal women

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal metabolism and endocrine development and function

interventions.interventions: Raloxifene 60mg and 120 mg daily and Tamoxifen 10 mg and 20 mg daily. Duration of treatment for each dose is 2 weeks with washout period of 2 weeks after cross over.
interventions.comparator: Cross over study. Oral administration of Raloxifene 60mg and 120 mg daily will be compared with Tamoxifen 10 mg and 20 mg daily.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Growth hormone (GH) secretion and response to stimuli, measurements of substrate metabolism by indirect calorimetry and protein turnover by leucine turnover technique.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after each treatment period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Biochemical markers of growth hormone - insulin-like growth factor I (GH-IGFI) axis
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after each treatment period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy postmenopausal women and healthy men the same age
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: obesity, diabetes, cancer, kidney or liver diseases, deep vein thrombosis

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Department of Endocrinology, St Vincent's Hospital

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We aim to investigate and compare the effects of raloxifene and tamoxifen (two most commonly used SERMs) in healthy men and women on the growth hormone system and metabolism.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: St Vincents Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee

contact.name: Prof Ken Ho, MD, FRACP, Head of Dept of Endocrinology, St Vincent’s Hospital
contact.address: Pituitary Research Unit Garvan Institute of Medical Research 384 Victoria Street Darlinghurst 2010 NSW
